00033 #ifndef __HASHMAP_H__
00034 #define __HASHMAP_H__
00035 #define MAP_MISSING -3  /* No such element */
00036 #define MAP_FULL -2   /* Hashmap is full */
00037 #define MAP_OMEM -1   /* Out of Memory */
00038 #define MAP_OK 0   /* OK */
00039 
00040 #include <inttypes.h>
00041 /*
00042  * any_t is a pointer.  This allows you to put arbitrary structures in
00043  * the hashmap.
00044  */
00045 typedef void *any_t;
00046 /*
00047  * PFany is a pointer to a function that can take two any_t arguments
00048  * and return an integer. Returns status code..
00049  */
00050 typedef int16_t (*PFany)(any_t, any_t);
00051 /*
00052  * map_t is a pointer to an internally maintained data structure.
00053  * Clients of this package do not need to know how hashmaps are
00054  * represented.  They see and manipulate only map_t's.
00055  */
00056 typedef any_t map_t;
00057 /*
00058  * Return an empty hashmap. Returns NULL if empty.
00059 */
00060 extern map_t hashmap_new();
00061 /*
00062  * Iteratively call f with argument (item, data) for
00063  * each element data in the hashmap. The function must
00064  * return a map status code. If it returns anything other
00065  * than MAP_OK the traversal is terminated. f must
00066  * not reenter any hashmap functions, or deadlock may arise.
00067  */
00068 extern int16_t hashmap_iterate(map_t in, PFany f, any_t item);
00069 /*
00070  * Add an element to the hashmap. Return MAP_OK or MAP_OMEM.
00071  */
00072 extern int16_t hashmap_put(map_t in, int32_t key, any_t value);
00073 /*
00074  * Get an element from the hashmap. Return MAP_OK or MAP_MISSING.
00075  */
00076 extern int16_t hashmap_get(map_t in, int32_t key, any_t *arg);
00077 /*
00078  * Remove an element from the hashmap. Return MAP_OK or MAP_MISSING.
00079  */
00080 extern int32_t hashmap_remove(map_t in, int32_t key);
00081 /*
00082  * Get any element. Return MAP_OK or MAP_MISSING.
00083  * remove - should the element be removed from the hashmap
00084  */
00085 extern int32_t hashmap_get_one(map_t in, any_t *arg, int32_t remove);
00086 /*
00087  * Free the hashmap
00088  */
00089 extern void hashmap_free(map_t in);
00090 /*
00091  * Get the current size of a hashmap
00092  */
00093 extern int16_t hashmap_length(map_t in);
00094 
00095 #endif
